title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern Pecan Pie that boasts a perfectly flaky crust and a luscious, gooey pecan filling. This timeless dessert is as beautiful as it is delicious, making it a show-stopping centerpiece for any holiday or special occasion.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled, diced butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out chilled dough and place into a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the prepared pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is set and golden brown.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set perfectly.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. When baking, watch the pie closely in the last 10 minutes to prevent the crust from burning. Let the pie cool fully to achieve the perfect slice.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie is a sensory delight, combining the crunch of toasted pecans with a rich, caramel-like filling nestled in a buttery, flaky crust. Its golden hue and inviting aroma make it a standout dessert that captures the warmth and tradition of Southern hospitality.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Perfect balance of crunchy pecans and smooth filling
  • Ideal for holidays, family gatherings, and special celebrations
  • Uses simple pantry staples for easy preparation
  • Beautiful presentation that impresses guests

structured_content.content: I first made this pie after receiving the recipe from my dear friend Joyce, who got it from a wise Southern lady. Every bite brings back memories of cozy family dinners and festive celebrations filled with laughter and love.

• Main ingredient: Pecans provide a rich, nutty crunch that defines this pie; use halves for an attractive top layer.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds warmth and depth to the filling.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs create a tender crust and luscious filling texture.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and oven for baking.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans on bottom. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake at high temperature for 10 minutes, then reduce heat and continue baking until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely before slicing to allow filling to firm up. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for extra indulgence.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at a high temperature to set the crust quickly.
  • Avoid underbaking to prevent a runny filling.
  • The filling is ready when it is golden brown and slightly puffed but still jiggles slightly in the center.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 5 days; reheat gently before serving.

structured_content.content: This pie has been a beloved staple at my family’s holiday table, sparking joy and nostalgia with every slice shared among loved ones. It’s more than dessert—it’s a tradition.
Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spiced twist. Toast the pecans lightly before adding for extra depth of flavor.
Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of sweet dessert wine for a perfect finish to any meal.
For gluten-free options, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can be made by using plant-based butter and egg replacers, though texture will vary slightly.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use chilled butter and ice water to create a flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid tough texture.
  • Start baking at high heat to set crust, then lower to finish cooking filling evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a glossy, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in hand, you’re ready to create a Southern classic that delights every time. Enjoy the process and the delicious results that bring smiles and sweet memories to your table.
